this round is formed from very tall stitches which will be latched up jacob s ladder style the very last qtr is not completed instead there will be a loose chain which will be sewn in to form the last and joining link this round will look extremely cupped before latching up don t panic it will all lie flat once complete join yarn c with a slip_stitch in any double_crochet chain 8 as qtr ch1 skip 1 qtr chain 1 x 34 skip 1 st pm in next st single_crochet in 7th chain of starting chain chain 8 as last qtr cut yarn leaving several inches spare and pull yarn through 36 qtr of which 1 is still a loose chain-8 36 chain-1 of which 1 is substituted by an single_crochet latching up take a large crochet hook mine is 7mm make a loop in the post of the first qtr starting chain pull the post of the second qtr through the loop continue latching up the qtr posts until only the loose chain-8 is left thread the loose chain 8 on a darning needle pass up through the last loop formed round the base of the first loop and back down the centre of the last loop sew to the marked st on the ws think of this finishing stitch almost like an invisible join 36 laddered loops give your work a gentle tug in all directions to settle the ladder and it should then lie quite flat joseph s ladder wreath © 2023 lettice rose 3 round 6 with yarn a starting with a standing st 2 single_crochet in every chain-1 of round 5 these spaces appear like back bars of the laddered loops slip_stitch to 1st single_crochet to join finish off 72 single_crochet round 7 with yarn d mpc in any single_crochet chain 3 skip 2 mpc
